Plugin Output: The parameter q is vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting. User input was returned unencoded in the HTML response body.
Description: A reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the q parameter of the /search endpoint on the payment service frontend. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that execute in the context of the victim's browser session, potentially stealing session tokens or performing actions on behalf of the user.
Steps to Remediate: Sanitize all user input and encode output. Implement Content-Security-Policy headers. Use framework-provided output encoding functions.

Proof: reflected in transaction memo field.
Plugin Output: The parameter name is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. Injected payload was persisted and rendered in the transaction detail view.
Description: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the name parameter of the /api/transactions/detail endpoint. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that are persisted and executed when other users view the transaction detail page.
Steps to Remediate: Sanitize and encode all user-provided data before storage and rendering. Implement Content-Security-Policy headers.

Proof: SQL error: You have an error in your SQL syntax near ''1 OR 1=1--'
Plugin Output: The parameter accountId is vulnerable to SQL injection. The application returned a database error when a crafted payload was submitted, indicating dynamic SQL construction.
Description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists in the accountId parameter of the /api/account/lookup endpoint. An attacker could execute arbitrary SQL queries against the backend database, potentially extracting sensitive financial data or modifying account records.
Steps to Remediate: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries. Apply input validation using allowlists.

Proof: Path traversal via crafted URL: GET /static/../../../../etc/passwd returned sensitive file content.
Plugin Output: The web application is vulnerable to a path traversal attack via the Spring Framework static resource handler. Crafted URL paths allow access to files outside the intended web root.
Description: A path traversal vulnerability exists in the static resource serving functionality powered by Spring Framework. An attacker can craft HTTP requests to traverse the file system and access arbitrary files accessible to the application process. This vulnerability matches CVE-2024-38816 in the Spring Framework dependency.
Steps to Remediate: Upgrade Spring Framework to version 6.1.12 or later. Restrict static resource serving to specific directories. Implement path validation.

Proof: Directory traversal: ../../../etc/shadow content returned in response.
Plugin Output: The parameter filePath is vulnerable to path traversal. An attacker can read arbitrary files from the server by manipulating the file path parameter.
Description: A path traversal vulnerability exists in the filePath parameter of the /api/files/download endpoint. An attacker can manipulate the file path to access files outside the intended directory, potentially reading configuration files, credentials, or other sensitive data.
Steps to Remediate: Validate and sanitize file path inputs. Use allowlists for permitted file names. Resolve the canonical path and verify it remains within the allowed directory.
